website_summaries.verdict: This stainless-steel ice axe with an aluminum shaft is lightweight and offers excellent performance.
pros: A good piece of safety equipment
Comes in sizes from 55 centimeters to 75 centimeters
cons: This will not double for use in the soil
It will get chewed up on rocks

customer_reviews.title: Best ice axe for beginners! Check it out in action on my Instagram - @zachoneverest
customer_reviews.text: I love this ice axe! It was super handy on my ascents of Rainier/Baker/Adams this last climbing season. The leash made everything easier since I didn't have to worry about dropping it and the quality of the axe is top-knotch! Direct message me on Instagram for any specific questions about the axe or if you need any mountaineering questions answered :) - @zachoneverest
customer_reviews.author: Zachary W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner IceDry Hiking Axe
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of hiking in Summit County Colorado and this gets me through the entire season-if you can find the rock pick for the summer. If you love hiking or are interested in learning how to climb using ice axes this is a great model to start with. The handle and lanyard help a lot! Spend the extra $10 bucks for these options. Youll be happy especially when you have you gloves on.
customer_reviews.author: jDiver

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent safety item, essential for hiking in icy weather. Good quality. It would be nice to have a protective cover for the blade included (I bought one separately).
customer_reviews.author: KittyL

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Sharp and lightweight... perfect to keep on hand for snowshoeing!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly as pictured.
customer_reviews.text: The one I received has no orange spacer at the top like every one iv'e seen. Fake?
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Great ice axe
customer_reviews.text: My husband said is Very good! Light and easy to handle! He used for climbing Mt. Adams!
customer_reviews.author: AriParker

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: No dislikes and I used this on lions head on mount Washington.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S Gilbrook

customer_reviews.title: Solid.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy piece of gear necessary for hiking near/on ice. The ability to self arrest is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Very useful hiking axe, don’t forget the spike protectors!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and lightweight! Recommend getting all of the spike covers at the same time!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is designed to do
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 75 cm, great little alpine axe, the leash is not necessary and at times gets in the way. Save yourself the money and buy without the leash.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Dave

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted and no dely with shipping it off.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Espinsoa

customer_reviews.title: Necessary
customer_reviews.text: Literally saved my life! Great piece of gear if you have the need.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: For any type of alpining, even scaling the great lakes of frozen tundra. The 70 incher is quite large for the beginner-pro.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus R.

customer_reviews.title: A great straight ice axe.
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the traditional straight ice axes so I bought a set of these. A good price and it has held up well thus far. The leash is nice. Works good to cut steps int he snow and I've used one of them to anchor down my tent in high winds. I've not been gentle with these axes but so far they've held up great. I like them so much I bought a 65cm set for my girlfriend. If you are going to do climbing up a sheer ice face you may want to go with a technical set of axes but for general mountaineering these work great.
customer_reviews.author: Bill in SoDak

customer_reviews.title: superior quality as expected
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as expected, superior quality as expected. Used it on several trips with no issues
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan S.

customer_reviews.title: A great, functional Ice Axe.
customer_reviews.text: I don't compare this to an axe costing twice as much, but it is an excellent choice in its price range.
customer_reviews.author: DToddTop Contributor: Chess

customer_reviews.title: Kudos
customer_reviews.text: Excellent seller, timely service abd product was as described. The product itself was great, though I'm not an ice climber persay I did give this two runs up a solid ice climb/hike and it gave me that extra layer of safety, didn't dull with use and is light and easy to carry/pack.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Rondinella

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ice axe!
customer_reviews.text: I love this axe! I found it to be a perfect fit and I, personally, love having the hand strap. The axe is light and very manageable. I found that I was able to glissade with this axe quite well. I'll be using this one for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: GrizzledAtoms

customer_reviews.title: Tough, light, and looks good
customer_reviews.text: Tough, light, and looks good - with the bonus of a rubber grip.
customer_reviews.author: cramblda

customer_reviews.title: I have done plenty with this axe.. from ...
customer_reviews.text: I have done plenty with this axe.. from Mt. Washington to Rainier over these past handful of years.. and it's held up marvelously.
customer_reviews.author: Iaso Nikko

product_meta.title: Black Diamond Raven Ice Axe with Grip - Anodized Light Gray
product_meta.description: 210358 Features: Get extra strength with the one-piece stainless steel head Easy-to-grip and comfortable, dual-density molded grip Comes equipped with a Slider Leash Easily penetrate hard-packed snow with the angled spike CEN-B certified Specifications: Weight: 1 lb 1 oz Head: stainless steel Shaft: 7075-T6 aluminum
feature_bullets: Investment-cast, One-piece stainless steel head with a large hole for a carabiner
Pick's Curve and teeth engineered for secure self-arresting
